title: Community Lore Survey: If you were a champion...
body:
Let's say you won a contest, and Riot has given you the opportunity to put "yourself" in the game, as it were. You know, a character of your design.

**Who would you serve?** (Would you serve one of the great nations? One of the city-states? Would you hail from the Shadow Isles? Or would you be an independent wild card?)

**What three champions would you have connections to?**

**What would your role be?**

**What would be your weapon of choice?** (League champions fight with all sorts of wild things. What would you fight with?)

**What would your champion's gender be?** (Presumably this would be your own gender as well, but hey, I'm not your mother!)

-----

The idea here is to get a measure for how the landscape of champions and factions would look if a ton of players had a chance to be represented in the game. Sure, I could just ask "Which faction do you like most?", but I feel like the picture this type of survey paints is so much more fascinating.

I will begin, as an example.

**[WHO WOULD YOU SERVE?]** Ionia. I love a scrappy defender, and if I had the chance, I'd want to be in there holding back the invasion with them.

**[WHAT THREE CHAMPIONS WOULD YOU HAVE CONNECTIONS TO?]** Irelia (comrade-in-arms), Darius (bitter rival), LeBlanc (forbidden love...? This one is largely a meta take on her being my former main, to be honest.)

**[WHAT WOULD YOUR ROLE BE?]** Definitely a supportank. Ionia needs more tanks!

**[WEAPON OF CHOICE?]** Fitting Ionia, I'd fight with a naginata type weapon. My theoretical champion would use sweeping strikes to keep enemies at bay. ... Hmm, now I have an idea for a champion concept...

**[WHAT WOULD YOUR CHAMPION'S GENDER BE?]** Male.

So let's hear it, from anyone interested. The game may have lost me, but the lore hasn't, and I'm really interested to see what it would look like if we all had a chance to make our "inner champion" a part of it.

**UPDATE:** When a reply gets my creative juices going, I'll reply to it with a cobbled together kit idea as my brain is seeing it, just for fun.

-----

# The Numbers Thus Far...

* **ORIGINS**
 * 2 champions are from **Demacia**.
 * 4 champions are from **Ionia**.
 * 6 champions are from **Zaun** (1 operates in Bilgewater, 1 operates in Ionia, 1 operates in Noxus).
 * 1 champion is from the **Freljord** (1 operates in Zaun).
 * 2 champion is from **Piltover**.
 * 1 champion is from **Shurima**.
 * 4 champions are **Independent**.
 * 2 champions have miscellaneous affiliations.
  * 1 serves the **Darkin**.
  * 1 is a part of the **Void**.
  * 1 is from **Icathia**.
  * 1 is from the **Kumungu Jungle**.

* **CONNECTIONS**
 * Submitted champions share **friendly** relations with 41 canon champions.
 * Submitted champions share **antagonistic** relations with 17 canon champions.
 * Submitted champions share **complicated** relations with 11 canon characters.


* **ROLES**
 * 6 champions are **supports** (1 is a tank).
 * 4 champions are **assassins**.
 * 1 champion is a **marksman**.
 * 5 champions are **junglers** (1 is a tank, 1 is an assassin).
 * 4 champions are **mages**. (1 is an assassin).
 * 4 champions are **midlaners** (1 can also support).
 * 2 champions are **bruisers**.
 * 2 champions are **toplaners**.


* **WEAPONS**
 * 8 champion is **melee**.
 * 9 champions are **ranged**.
 * 4 champions are **casters**.
 * 3 champions' basic attacks are uncertain.


* **GENDER DISTRIBUTION**
 * 19 champions are **male**.
 * 4 champions are **female**.
 * 1 champion is a wisp.

**EDIT:** GOODNESS this took off. Thanks to everyone who got in on this! It's really fun to read through everyone's concepts. I'm having trouble keeping up with the statistics above, though, so I may quit keeping them for the sake of my eyes. :P Would love to keep reading everyone's ideas, though, and coming up with theoretical kits when a concept floods my brain with ideas!

# The kit I see for your champion looks a bit like...

**[RESOURCE]**
Mana, I'd say.

**[PASSIVE: Zaun-Made Mister]**
Your auto-attack has a fluid animation and a flat attack speed of 1.0. When your attack hits an enemy, it applies a corrosive chemical that deals your base AD as physical damage over 2.5 seconds. Sustaining the spraying animation stacks the damage and duration each second, up to a maximum of 400% damage over 10 seconds. Continuing to sustain the animation beyond this will refresh the effect at its maximum values every second.

**[Q: Glassblossom]** (Mana: 45/50/55/60/65) (Cooldown: 10s)
Grow a glassy northern flower at a targeted location that lasts for up to 60 seconds. When an enemy champion or jungle monster steps on it, they begin to bleed for AP-based damage over 5 seconds. Bleeding champions leave a trail of blood when they walk. You can auto-attack your blossoms to extend their duration by 1 second per mister tick, but can only plant up to 6 at a time regardless.

**[W: Ionian Guilebloom]** (Mana: 60/70/80/90/100) (Cooldown: 10s)
Grow a beautiful flower at a targeted location that, after 0.75 seconds, expels a sweet aroma in a moderate radius. Any champion, ally or enemy, in the area of effect becomes disarmed for 1.5/2/2.5/3/3.5 seconds.

_Also works on jungle monsters._

**[E: Serylda's Horn]** (Mana: 80) (Cooldown: 20s/19s/18s/17s/16s)
Grow a thick, woody vine at a targeted location that springs up, grabbing any champion or jungle monster standing on its tiny area of effect. The vines stun the affected champion for up to 6 seconds, growing up the champion's body as they do so. The vines have a health bar which begins at 100/200/300/400/500 (+50% of AP) and increases by half the base value each second. Half of all incoming damage is transferred to the vines, and if they break, the effect ends early. Your own basic attack does no damage, but instead heals your vines for the amount of damage you would otherwise deal.

_Allies can target and attack affected champions. 100% of this damage will be taken by the vines._

**[R: Cross-Breeding]** (Mana: None) (Cooldown: None)
By spending a Wild Seed, which occasionally spawn in bushes near you and can be collected for later use, you can combine any two abilities to create a new ability. You can hold up to 1/3/5 Wild Seeds at once. The mana cost and effects of each ability created through Cross-Breeding are affected by the level of Cross-Breeding itself.

* **[Q+W: Siren's Mirror]** (Mana: 80/100/120) (Cooldown: 10s for both)
Grow a pinkish, reflective flower at a targeted location that lasts for up to 60 seconds. When stepped on, the flower emits a maddening aroma. The affected champion will run to and auto-attack their nearest ally for 3/4/5 seconds, however far away that champion may be. The champion is chosen when the effect triggers, and doesn't change when relative distances shuffle.

_Siren's Mirror has the same mister interaction and planting limit as Glassblossom._

* **[Q+E: Avarosa's Bow]** (Mana: 135) (Cooldown: 20s for both)
Grow a hearty vine-plant with jagged, glass-like thorns that spreads across a targeted line over 2.5 seconds and lasts for 3 more. Enemies who walk across the vines are tangled and immobilized for the rest of the plant's duration, taking magic damage each second based on AP. You can mist the vines to extend their duration by 1 second per mister tick, up to a maximum of 6 seconds after full growth.

* **[W+E: Zaun Viperleaf]** (Mana: 80/110/150) (Cooldown: 15s for both)
Grow a glowing green plant at a targeted location that persists for 5/7/10 seconds. Enemy champions or jungle monsters who pass near will cause vines to grow across the ground and seek them out, following their path, which persist as long as the flower does. Enemies who walk across these vines are slowed by 70% for 1 second and take damage based on your AP. As long as they continue to stand on a vine, these effects will refresh each second.

If a vine reaches its target, it stings the prey. The vine will stop chasing that target, but the sting applies a poison that deals 50/100/150 (+15% of AP) magic damage per second over 6 seconds.

# The kit I see for your champion looks a bit like...

**[RESOURCE]**
I see you as a champion that uses Energy.

**[PASSIVE: Hot Goods]**
You cannot buy traditional trinkets. Instead, you have a selection of items you can buy for 100 gold that take up your trinket slot. When used on an enemy champion, these items provide a unique debuff for 1 minute. Planting an item on a champion with an active plant will overwrite the debuff with the new one.

* **Faulty Power Converter:** (2 + Level)% of the target's bonus AD is converted to bonus AP, and vice versa.
* **Rusting Agent:** The target's bonus Armor and Magic Resist decrease by 5 every 10 seconds. When the effect ends, original values are restored.
* **Bilgewater Leech:** The target's maximum Health decreases by 1% every 5 seconds. When the effect ends, original values are restored.
* **Tinkered Mana Battery:** The target's abilities cost (Level)% more Mana or Energy than usual.
* **Magnetic Field Generator:** The target's movement speed is decreased by (Level)%.

**[Q: Tripwire]** (Energy: 40 on second cast) (Cooldown: 18s/17s/16s/15s/14s)
The first cast fires your harpoon launcher via a narrow skillshot into a piece of terrain or an enemy unit. The second fires it into another piece of terrain, a champion, or the ground, with a moderate maximum range (about the width of a lane). Once both are cast, the rope persists for 3 seconds, stunning enemies who walk over it for 0.5 seconds. Enemies may only be stunned by this once every 3 seconds.

If a champion is hit by one of the harpoons, they take physical damage and are anchored to the other harpoon for the duration, unable to move away from it beyond the maximum length of the rope. The rope will move with them, and enemies touching it are still stunned for 0.5 seconds. If two enemy champions are hit, they are unable to move away from eachother beyond the maximum length of the rope.

**[E: Ripcord]** (Energy: 25) (Cooldown: 12s/11s/10s/9s/8s)
You fire your harpoon as a narrow skillshot, with an attached chain behind it. If the harpoon collides with terrain, you are pulled to that terrain and launched forward a short distance, allowing you to clear walls. If the harpoon collides with an enemy champion, they take physical damage. For the next 2 seconds, you can either recast E to pull yourself to them, or cast Q to pull them to you. Either way, the target is stunned for 0.25 seconds on arrival.

**[W: Flash Bang]** (Energy: 20) (Cooldown: 5s)
You throw a flashbang as a targeted area cast. Within a small radius around the point if impact, enemies are blinded and have their vision distance reduced to a small radius around them for 3 seconds. Within a larger circle outside the point of impact, enemies are blinded for 1.5 seconds.

**[R: Armorbane]** (Energy: 20) (Cooldown: 1s)
A targeted attack with a very short range that fires an imbued harpoon, dealing half of your AD as physical damage and half as true damage.

{{sticker:sg-lux}} 
Nice work, but I hope you don't mind some nitpicks:

---

I feel like Energy is too closely tied to Ionias Ki user. For a hextech user Mana (ammunition) makes more sense IMHO
I also don't feel like giving him Energy is relevant gameplaywise as he isn't cycling through combos like the others and doesn't regain energy in any way.

Passive: Losing the trinket slot seems annoying, since you lose wards or sweeper that are quite important for gameplay. Most of these options are just plain boring, as they require little gameplay and only affect stats, and have no counterplay (and thus are unfun for the enemy)
100 gold for a 1 minute debuff also seems really cheap to be honest.

Q: Love the ability since it just fits (smuggler fighting diry and utilizing the harpoon). The anchor mechanic is way too powerfull, unless counterplay is introduced (rope has health/reaching maximum length tears the rope, but deals high damage). Minor complaint is that it isn't a Q ability, which usually have low CD and are more damage oriented.

W: Now that is a Q ability (5 sec CD). A 1.5-3 second blind every 5 seconds would probably make this Teemo level of annoying for AA champions.

E: The visuals seem very similair to Q, which feels a bit lacking. Tying Q and E together would eat a lot of power budget, but makes more sense (in that case you would ALT Q/E to chain yourself to the harpoon). I imagine an assassin/smuggler as athletic, but not exactly beefy, so pulling enemies sounds wrong. I feel like having a reactivation in both instances would make it more consistent.

R: Honestly that doesn't sound like an Ultimate and more like a basic ability.

---

**I hope I don't seem ungrateful. You did a very good job, but I just can't help myself with nitpicking, especially since I am not unrelated to the concept.**

Fine by me! This is how concepts are refined, after all. :) RE: Trinkets, I had my doubts about that too. If I were to refine it, I'd up their cost to about 300 and allow the option of buying regular old trinkets.
Wouldn't it make more sense to not replace trinkets, but buy a buff (like elixiers) that affects the R or something like that?

Not a bad idea either, actually! We could definitely do that. The idea was "smuggling an item" and sneaking it onto an enemy champ, but I could absolutely go with like loading special ammo modifiers into the harpoon launcher and delivering them with the R.

I like it. I can even see some nice abilities here. Launch a harpoon into terrain to pull you to it, or a champion to pull them to you. Throw a flashbang to blind both champion and player for a few seconds, giving you a clear chance to jump in and burst them... I'd play a champion with this concept.

If we were just taking ourselves and placing them in the game.  Then I would be a middle-aged scholar whose former strength has long passed me by.  Probably in Targon shouting at the Aspects and getting smote in 30 seconds.

If we're going to do the idealized version of myself.

SERVE

Demacia.  I'm a medieval historian.  I like medieval stuff.  Plus Demacia has the whole small but most elite army thing going, and isn't dependent on magic to do things.  Sounds good to me.  Could do without the xenophobia though.  And the decor could get monotonous. White is a pretty boring color for every damn building.

CONNECTIONS

This is kind of tough.  I like the concept of Demacia plenty, but have no actual attachment to any Demacian champion.  Jarvan is pretty boring for a leader.  Garen/Lux have their own thing going on.  

I'd probably just respect Garen without getting too wrapped up in his personal affairs.

I'd never really understand his like of Taric, who I'd see as a waste of talent and opportunity who should have been punished more severly for his gross incompetence.

And I'd probably respect the hell out of Darius and Swain.  Worthy opponents and all that.

WHAT WOULD YOUR ROLE BE

Top.  It's just what I play.

WEAPON OF CHOICE

So here is where things would get interesting for me.  So, there are multiple ways I could go with this.  Technically the weapons I am actually trained in using are pistols, rifles, knives, longsword, and rapier and buckler.  The first two don't fit Demacia.  The last one wouldn't fit my body type in a game (besides it's easily my worst).  That leaves longsword.  However, LoL already has a lot of guys with big swords.  None of them actually use them well, but they have them.

So, again going for idealized version of myself.  I have always loved the medieval pollax.  It can stab, it can cut, it can hack, it can bludgeon.  Ahh, so much fun.  The few times I got to handle one felt great, too.  So that's my primary idea.  Being my favorite weapon and all.

The other idea is to go back to my own life.  I started poor and worked my way up to comfortably upper middle class.  If I wanted to go that route with my character's story arc, I'd have him start as a pikeman.  It'd be interesting to see how Riot would handle the concept of a pike in the game.  A melee weapon with a huge range, all about area control, and movement denial, with little to no mobility for myself.

And I’m a guy. For what it’s worth.

Going the pike route, since that's what we're curious about here. if you'd like to see an angle with a halberd or the like, however, let me know and I'll see what I can do with that as well.

# The kit I see for your champion looks a bit like...

I wanna give you a bit of an edge to make up for your low mobility, so I've decided to go Energy.

**[PASSIVE: Never Give Ground]**
Movement-increasing effects on you are halved, including those from boots. However, the duration (and thus distance) of all displacement effects on you are also halved. You count as melee, but your basic attack has 250% greater range than a typical melee attack.

**[Q: Phalanx Thrust]** (Energy: 15) (Cooldown: 10s/9s/8s/7s/6s)

Become immobile and immune to displacement effects for up to 3 seconds, pointing your pike forward. Enemies that approach from the front take physical damage based on their movement speed at the time of impact, an are slowed by 50% as they continue to run towards you. Cooldown begins after the effect ends.

Target an enemy and deliver a physical attack that pushes them to the edge of your attack range, then stuns them for 2 seconds.

Switch to a short sword, removing all effects from your passive for up to 10 seconds. While active, you gain 50/75/100% bonus attack speed. Using another ability cancels this effect early.
